tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: What's your take on: "When the sun rise in the west and sets in the east, when the seas go dry and and mountains blow in the...
question: What's your take on: "When the sun rise in the west and sets in the east, when the seas go dry and and mountains blow in the wind like leaves, when your wonb quickens again and bears a living child, he will return"? Any theories you'd like to share?
answer:
Hey. Honestly? I don’t have a full take on it. I mean, I’ve thought over it and puzzled over it before, and have some clues as to what some of it means, but I honestly haven’t come up with any interpretation of it that works for the whole thing satisfactorily. 

I will say, I’m in the process of working on a meta about prophecies in ASOIAF/GOT, and I think this one is a clear indication of what George R. R. Martin calls the weasel-wording technique when it comes to prophecies. Namely, the interpretation of it isn’t supposed to be literal. 

Like, the part about “the sun rise in the west and set in the east” could refer (and I think does refre) to Quentyn Martell. He is a “sun” twice over, being both a Martell and their House Sigil being a sun with a spear through it, along with him being born in the castle of Sunspear; as well as being the son of Doran Martell, the ruling Prince of Dorne. He “rises in the west,” meaning he was born and lived/was raised in Westeros, and then came to Essos where he “sets in the east” i.e. dies.

Oh, and also, what Mirri Maz Duur said actually isn’t even about Dany having a child, but when Drogo will return, specifically “when he will be as he was” which is what Dany specifically asked (in the books). So this prophecy isn’t even about when she would see Drogo again, (i.e. in some kind of afterlife), or even about when or if she could ever have a living child again. It’s about when Drogo will be as he was. 

In the books, Dany’s womb has quickened again, when she had her accidental miscarriage at the end of A Dance With Dragons. So that part of what Maz Durr said has also come to pass. She just now needs to bear a living child, which I’ve always been pretty sure she was going to do (with Jon).

However those are the only parts of that prophecy I’ve ever been confident about figuring out. I have no idea what the other parts of it mean.

summary: @ people saying daenerys would kill missandei if she wanted to go home / that dany forces poc around her to stay with her and /...
body:
@ people saying daenerys would kill missandei if she wanted to go home / that dany forces poc around her to stay with her and / or fight for her

“Say the word, my sweet, and I will send you away from this awful place. I will find you a ship somehow and send you home, to Naath.”

“I would sooner stay with you. On Naath I’d be afraid. What if the slavers come again? I feel safer with you.”

summary:
Daenerys: “He usually slams me into the bedding and I have to bite into a pillow so everyone doesn’t hear me screaming.”
Sansa:...
body:
Jon Snow has aggressive sex when he’s drunk and Daenerys loves it

Daenerys: “He usually slams me into the bedding and I have to bite into a pillow so everyone doesn’t hear me screaming.”

Sansa: “What? That’s horrible”

Daenerys: “Yes. I feel the bruises for the entirety of the next day…”

Sansa: “I’m so sorry your grace. Our father taught him better than this.”

Arya: “wait…”

Both women turn to her

Arya: “If you know this… then why haven’t you tried stopping him from drinking. Actually…you asked the servant girl a while ago to bring him and Lord Tyrion more wine and ale.”

Sansa: “…”

Daenerys:

Meanwhile

Tyrion: “More wine or ale, Jon?”

Jon: “Aye. Daenerys told me to enjoy myself tonight. Though…she’s told me to enjoy myself and appreciate the finer things of drinking these past few days…”

Tyrion: “…”

Jon: “…”

summary:
We all know that Daenerys and Jon’s story parallel each other in a great deal, but something I haven’t seen much;
Ned Stark and...
body:
We all know that Daenerys and Jon’s story parallel each other in a great deal, but something I haven’t seen much;

Ned Stark and Daenerys Targaryen

It’s nothing world breaking or story shattering, but nonetheless pretty cool how it has played out:

Ned Stark risked his life and everything he could to protect Rhaegar and Lyanna’s son. He risked his position and everting to protect Daenerys from Robert.

Now Daenerys wil risk her life, her dragons, and everything she has worked towards to protect Rhaegar and Lyanna’s son. She is now risking it all to protect his children from the NK. And no matter what certain fans say, she will protect them and fight for their safety.

I’m just a sucker for parallels, especially in storytelling. And seeing this made me appreciate this story even more :’)

summary: Okay, so, I was not expecting this post about wanting to use Dandelion as Dany’s nickname (bc its super cute!) to get nearly as...
body: Okay, so, I was not expecting this post about wanting to use Dandelion as Dany’s nickname (bc its super cute!) to get nearly as much attention as it did. But, my fellow super awesome Jonerys shippers and Dany stans have made it clear, most of us are totally down for using Dandelion as her nickname. So, it’s official! Let’s reclaim such a cute name that antis tried to use in an insulting manner (that wasn’t actually insulting to begin with)!!!

reblog.comment: Okay, so, I was not expecting this post about wanting to use Dandelion as Dany’s nickname (bc its super cute!) to get nearly as much attention as it did.
